result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason E Francis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
As of 12/2/2016:  Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.   Refund check was issued to deft./poster.

Costs are to be paid at $50 per month commencing 11-03-2014 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid or 11 days Jail with Huber as penalty for failure to pay costs.
DAY REPORT CENTER:  30 DAYS.  Defendant to report to Day Report on 09-10-2014.

Defendant Jason E Francis in court with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.

State moves to strike the repeater enhancer.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Court strikes the repeater enhancer.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Day Report Program

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on June 2, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jason E Francis in court.  Barbara A Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation immediately following court and is to return for further scheduling.
MATTER RECALLED AT 10:58.   Appearances are as they were prior.    Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation..    Defendant requested that the Court appoint Counsel - Court granted.   The court orders that the defendant pay $75/month commencing 05/15/14 and each month thereafter.  The court appoints Attorney Kate Lindgren, barring no conflict.
Attorney Lindgren in court and accepts the appointment.  State provides discovery, complaint and information.
Hearing on April 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Jason E Francis in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant still has not gone to seek counsel. Defendant stated that he just received the state's pre-trial offer and he does not wish to seek counsel and will waive his preliminary hearing.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on March 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jason E Francis in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised court that he can not afford an attorney. Defendant has not gone to the Public Defender's Office, because he does not believe he'll qualify.   State has no offer to amend charges. Court advised defendant that he must go to the Public Defender's Office then if he does not qualify, he can petition for appointment of counsel. Defendant would like to do that.   Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled.  Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with the victim as except thru any family court order.   Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

Defendant Jason E Francis in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to seek counsel.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.
